title: How to Hide in Hide and Seek

steps.headline: Survey the area and layout of the hiding area.
steps.description: Ask for a few minutes before the game to look around the area and get familiar with the hiding spots. Try making a map and/or a list of hiding places where you can hide.

steps.headline: Go over any rules specific to the hiding area.
steps.description: Be sure that everyone knows the rules ( boundaries, private rooms, whatever.)

steps.headline: Choose who is it.
steps.description: Make sure that everyone likes who is it and that the person they chose is a fair size. ( The smallest person shouldn't be it.) You might choose it by doing a quick game of rock, paper, scissors or you might say a tongue twister and see who gets it wrong.

steps.headline: Enforce a smaller number over a larger one when you're counting.
steps.description: This will be useful for you as the hiders will have to dash to their hiding places. They'll likely be out of breath and you won't have to wait around counting.

steps.headline: Start counting.
steps.description: While you count, the hiders will run to their hiding places. When you are done the counting, you will look for them.

steps.headline: Check everywhere.
steps.description: It may seem like a waste of time, but even the most obvious places are hiding places in a hider's mind. Pretend that you are a hider, and you will probably think in the same way.

steps.headline: Be silent.
steps.description: If you are being loud, not only will you alert hiders to your presence, but you will not be able to hear the hiders. Be sure to listen for noises the hiders will make. If you hear laughing, whispering, coughing, and sneezing, then you will know you've found someone.

steps.headline: Look out for distractions.
steps.description: Expert hiders and even some beginner hiders will carry a squeaky toy or a bottle cap that they can throw far away from the hiding place. If you hear something, check the area it fell quickly and carefully as it might have been something that fell from a hider's pocket. If you find the object that was thrown, pick it up and take it with you so that the hider can't retrieve it and use it again.

steps.headline: When you find someone, depending on the rules, they will either help you find the rest of the hiders or sit down somewhere and wait until you find the rest.
steps.description: Whoever you have found first will be it in the next game.

steps.headline: Don't give yourself away.
steps.description: Many hiders will show where they are going to hide by looking at a certain place or getting ready to run to a certain place. Instead, you should look at another place that's far away from where you are going to hide.

steps.headline: Hide close to where the seeker is counting.
steps.description: Unless the seeker is an expert, he/she most likely won't check next to where they are counting. However, if you don't know if the seeker is an expert, don't try to hide there as you will likely be found first.

steps.headline: Walk slowly.
steps.description: Even if the seeker is counting to a very small number like ten, don't dash madly to get to your hiding place. You will be out of breath and if you are still running while the seeker is looking, he/she will hear you.

steps.headline: Don't leave any evidence!
steps.description: No matter how perfect your hiding place is, IT WILL BE FOUND if you leave evidence. Try not to bring your phone unless you must; it will make noise and the light might show through your pocket. Also, don't bring keys, coins, or anything else that will jingle in your pocket.

steps.headline: Use a simple strategy.
steps.description: Try hiding in rooms the seeker has already checked or stay where you are; it all depends on which one you think is better. If you have a really good hiding place no one has ever found, stay there only for the first half of the game. If you stay there the whole game, you will be found and you'll have to think of another hiding place.
